# setContentsRectNeedsUpdate()

**Instance Method**

Informs the view that contains the image when the layout changes and the view needs to reload its content.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor final func setContentsRectNeedsUpdate()
```

## Discussion

The framework ignores calls to this method when the superview is of type [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppKit/NSImageView].

If the superview is a class other than `NSImageView`, call this method when the layout changes. The overlay view then invokes the delegate’s [doc://com.apple.VisionKit/documentation/VisionKit/ImageAnalysisOverlayViewDelegate/contentsRect(for:)-34yzu] method to request the new content area.

## Managing custom image views

- **contentsRect**: Returns the rectangle, in unit coordinates, that contains the image within the superview.
